page.title: 13Eyton Church
page.content: The{church}is named after St. Katherine.Which was built in Eyton in 1743.The large stained glass window had a Latin date on it.MDCCCLV-1855. There is a balcony overlooking all the seats and the whole church.Robert Eyton has been said to have accompanied Richard the 1st in a crusade to Palestine.The story said that Robert's wife promised to build a church if Robert returned safely.He did come back,and a church was built, but it isn't known whether this is true,although there was a church standing at that time.The tower is very old now and the floors are not safe in places.The bells were hung in 1753.There are 3 bells but one of the has cracked.The church does not have its own vicar.Services are taken by the vicar of Wellington parish church.
